text: oh this is amazing! thank you! i’ll test it!
I seem to be getting this errors when running test on custom code blocks, need to retry multiple times before the same code runs. Anyone experiencing this as well?
I'm currently not experiencing this, <@U022ANB8ZC4> and <@U02EFVAAGCR> do you guys know of any possible issues on the HubSpot side?

Some more info:
• Using Node JS
• Loading in 25-isch properties
• They are number fields, but came in as text fields, so had to convert them all using Number() function (Using Number function in and out array seemed to give no difference)
• Have an array with objects that include said numbers
• using sort function on array
• callback of 3 variables
It seemed like the issue occured when I used the Number() or parseInt() functions. But pressing test again usually gave the test results
Is there a certain advantage on using Node js or Python in custom code?
Node is going to be faster at most things, but really it's mostly just personal preference

It may not be a great reason, but just know that every frontend developer at HubSpot works 100% with JS and little to no Python. It could come in handy to speak the same language. But like Carter said, it’s a personal preference. I personally like Python better for scripting.
I'm just keeping everything in Node then haha :joy:, I personally like my scripting in golang :eyes:
we have a team that uses Go internally, seems fun
Do they use it for anything operational? which team?

Hi everyone!
How are you? hope you are doing well :slightly_smiling_face:
